qas.question: What was an objective of Turkey after its expansion into the Balkans?
What empire were the controlled lands surrounding Constantinople formerly controlled by?
What leader invaded Anatolia from the east?
Timur was the founder of what?
What battle between Timur and the Ottoman empire took place in 1402?

context: With the extension of Turkish dominion into the Balkans, the strategic <a0_0>conquest of Constantinople<a0_0/> became a crucial objective. The empire had managed to control nearly all former <a1_0>Byzantine<a1_0/> lands surrounding the city, but in 1402 the Byzantines were temporarily relieved when the Turco-Mongol leader <a2_0>Timur<a2_0/>, founder of the <a3_0>Timurid Empire<a3_0/>, invaded Anatolia from the east. In the <a4_0>Battle of Ankara<a4_0/> in 1402, Timur defeated the Ottoman forces and took Sultan Bayezid I as a prisoner, throwing the empire into disorder. The ensuing civil war lasted from 1402 to 1413 as Bayezid's sons fought over succession. It ended when Mehmed I emerged as the sultan and restored Ottoman power, bringing an end to the Interregnum, also known as the Fetret Devri.
